overview_of_class: This course examines aspects of aging, from molecular to evolutionary, and explores what is presently known about how and why we age. Through discussions of primary literature, students will explore various biological processes and disease states related to aging. Rather than providing a comprehensive overview, this course aims to develop a fundamental framework for how to think about the biology of aging and the ability to read and analyze current scientific literature.
name: Biology of Aging
title: SCS BIOL_SCI 327-CN-66 Biology of Aging

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course examines aspects of aging, from molecular to evolutionary, and explores what is presently known about how and why we age. Through discussions of primary literature, students will explore various biological processes and disease states related to aging. Rather than providing a comprehensive overview, this course aims to develop a fundamental framework for how to think about the biology of aging and the ability to read and analyze current scientific literature.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Prerequisites: BIOL SCI 219 (formerly BIOL SCI 216 or BIOL SCI 210-C), and BIOL SCI 217

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
At the completion of this course, students will be able to:
1) Evaluate scientific data and draw conclusions supported by evidence
2) Identify and describe foundational aspects of cellular and organismal aging

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: The course will include a variety of teaching methods. In addition to lectures and in-class group activities students will read, present and discuss published research.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Evaluation methods will include class participation, quizzes and a final exam.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: All course materials will be made available to students on Canvas.
